Type.Name: NativeConvert

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit NativeConvert extends System.Object

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

Docs.summary: Performs conversions between managed and unmanaged enumeration values.

remarks.para: Different operating systems give different values to the same identifier. For example, SIGBUS is 10 under FreeBSD, while it's 7 for x86 Linux. Meanwhile, will have the same value everywhere. Since it is undesirable to require recompilation for every target platform, the namespace instead exports a stable ABI, and provides conversion functions to convert between the managed and appropriate OS-specific values.
Normally this conversion is handled transparently by the wrapper functions, so members of this class shouldn't need to be used.

block.para: You cannot blindly cast a value to an enumeration without sacrificing portability, as the platform may not support the value you want.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Mono.Unix.Native.FilePermissions FromUnixPermissionString (string value);
.method public static hidebysig valuetype Mono.Unix.Native.FilePermissions FromUnixPermissionString(string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The unix permission representation of a value.
Docs.summary: Converts a unix permission representation of a into a .

remarks.para: A "Unix permission string" is the 9 or 10 character string commonly seen in the output of ls -l, e.g. "-rwxr-x---".
This method makes it easier to create a value, allowing the use of common Unix permission notation.
Both 9 and 10 character representations are decoded, the difference being the file type.

Docs.summary: Converts an OS-specific value to a .
Docs.returns: An approximation of the equivalent managed value.

remarks.para: The current conversion functions are unable to determine if a value in a [Flags]-marked enumeration does not exist on the current platform. As such, if contains a flag value which the current platform doesn't support, it will not be present in the managed value returned.
This should only be a problem if was not previously returned by .

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToUnixPermissionString (Mono.Unix.Native.FilePermissions value);
.method public static hidebysig string ToUnixPermissionString(valuetype Mono.Unix.Native.FilePermissions value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts a into a Unix permission string.

remarks.para: A "Unix permission string" is the 9 or 10 character string commonly seen in the output of ls -l, e.g. "-rwxr-x---".

Both 9 and 10 character representations are encoded, the difference being the file type. If a file type is specified, a 10 character string is returned, with the file type encoded in the first character. Otherwise a 9 character string is returned.

The current conversion functions are unable to determine if a value in a [Flags]-marked enumeration does not exist on the current platform. As such, if contains a flag value which the current platform doesn't support, it will not be present in the managed value returned.
This should only be a problem if was not previously returned by .
